author: realbigsean
content:
So Lighthouse currently uses both `net_version` and `eth_chainId` from the eth1 API because both are mentioned in the eth2 spec: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/configs/mainnet/phase0.yaml#L54-L55

Do we need both or could we just use `eth_chainId` ? There is an issue with `net_version` on geth's master branch, which brought this up. And it seems like `eth_chainId` should generally be preferred

author: ajsutton
content:
`net_version` is incorrect, though it won't matter for GÃ¶rli or MainNet.  `net_version` actually reports the network ID, whereas `eth_chainId` report the chain ID.  In every public ethereum network I know of, network ID and chain ID are the same.  They are however different in many private chains and are different for ETC mainnet.

Historically there was only `net_version` so confusingly it used to return the chain ID in some clients for compatibility with MetaMask but `eth_chainId` has been around for a year or two now and MetaMask switched to it so `net_version` now typically returns the network ID like it should.

Bottom line if you care which chain is in use, use `eth_chainId` - if you care which p2p network its connected to (not sure why you would - ETH and ETC use the same devp2p), use `net_version`.
